This authorization will remain in effect until all amounts I owe to Perch Community Solar Acquisition, LLC, or an assignee in connection with the community solar agreement have been paid in full or this authorization is cancelled in writing by providing notice of cancellation to Perch Community Solar, LLC, or its designee, by email at customercare@perchenergy.com, by mail at P.O. Box 170718, Boston, MA 02117, or online at https://portal.perchenergy.com/customerportal. I understand and agree that Perch Community Solar, LLC, must receive written notice of any changes in the account information or termination of this authorization at least three (3) business days prior to the next billing date.
Perch Community Solar Acquisition, LLC, or its servicer(s), or an assignee or such assignee’s servicer(s), including but not limited to Perch Community Solar, LLC

A community member like you enjoys saving money and cares about supporting the development of clean energy, so they sign up to support a project. With their support, our partners can build a community solar farm in your region. Once the solar farm is operational, the power it generates is sent to the local utility for distribution on the grid. Then, the member receives credits on their electric bill and they pay for those credits at a reduced rate.

With a Perch Community Solar membership, you save money while supporting the development of solar energy. By signing up, you will receive bill credits that reduce your monthly electric bill and you’ll enjoy peace of mind knowing that support contributes to job growth and cleaner electric generation in your area.
What are the benefits of a Perch Community Solar membership?
Community Solar is a state incentivized program that makes it possible for homeowners, renters, and businesses to support solar without needing to install their own solar panels.
How is community solar different from rooftop solar?

Depending on the project and your location, you can expect to save somewhere between 5%-10% on electricity throughout the year. While you will save on your electric bill every month that credits are applied, the amount of savings will vary. Savings are generally higher during the summer months when solar production is at its peak and lower during the winter months when the sun shines less. Of course, variations in how much energy you use will also affect how much you save.
How much can I save with a Perch Community Solar membership?

If you move within your utility territory, it’s simple: you can take your membership with you. If you move to a new utility territory, you can cancel free of charge. However, we ask for 90 days’ notice.
What if I have to move or cancel?

We help people protect the planet by making cleaner energy options more accessible, more affordable and more equitable for all. Perch has managed more than 135 MW of projects, providing community solar access to thousands of customers, both through our own solar farms and through farms developed by others.
The oldest manmade satellite has been in orbit since 1958 and is powered by solar.
In one hour, more energy from the sun falls on the Earth than is used by everyone around the world in an entire year.
When there’s a huge solar spill, it's just called a sunny day.
